graph.packing

Class GASPPacker

  • java.lang.Object
    • graph.packing.GASPPacker

  • public final class GASPPacker
extends java.lang.Object
    Implements a GRASP algorithm for the 2-packing problem where however, there is always a "best" free node to select from whenever the set of free nodes is non-empty, thus the name "GASP" instead of "GRASP".

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011

    Company:

      java.util.Set pack()
      create a dist-2 packing for Graph _g via a GASP method and return it as a Set of the active nodes.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GASPPacker

        public GASPPacker(Graph g)
           throws ParallelException
        constructs a GASPPacker object with the given Graph argument. The Graph is not copied (for efficiency reasons), so it should not be modified in any way from another thread while the pack() method of the class is running.
        Parameters:
        g - Graph
        Throws:
        ParallelException

    • Method Detail

      • pack

        public java.util.Set pack()
                   throws ParallelException
        create a dist-2 packing for Graph _g via a GASP method and return it as a Set of the active nodes.
        Returns:
        Set // Set
        Throws:
        ParallelException

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        invoke as java -cp <classpath> graph.packing.GASPPacker <graph_file> . The graph_file contains the graph in the format specified in the comments of method utils.DataMgr.readGraphFromFile2(filename). The solution found is also written in the file "sol.out" in the current directory. It contains one line for each node included in the solution, and the line has the internal id of the node +1 (so the range of nodes is [1,...Graph.getNumNodes()].
        Parameters:
        args - String[]
